what do I call my grandfather's aunt's son

info.title: Wolfram Language API
info.description: API for evaluating Wolfram Language code and finding semantic Wolfram Language representations of natural language inputs.

200.description: The result of the Wolfram Language evaluation

400.description: The request is missing the 'input' parameter

500.description: Wolfram Cloud was unable to generate a result

503.description: Service temporarily unavailable. This may be the result of too many requests.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Wolfram Language code to be evaluated

get.description: Interprets simplified natural language inputs as Wolfram Language entities, entity classes, or more complex reverse-lookups.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Simplified natural language input to be interpreted.

200.description: Successful response with the interpreted Wolfram Language entity or entity class.

interpretation.description: The interpreted Wolfram Language entity or entity class.

get.description: Returns EntityClass interpretations for a specified type and input.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the Wolfram entity for EntityClass interpretation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The input for EntityClass interpretation.

200.description: Successful response with the EntityClass interpretation.

interpretation.description: The EntityClass interpretation of the provided type and input.

get.description: Returns EntityProperty interpretations for a specified type and input.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the Wolfram entity for EntityProperty interpretation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The input for EntityProperty interpretation.

200.description: Successful response with the EntityProperty interpretation.

interpretation.description: The EntityProperty interpretation of the provided type and input.

get.description: Returns usage information for Wolfram Language symbols.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: The Wolfram Language symbol for which to retrieve documentation.

200.description: Successful response with the usage information of the symbol.

documentation.description: The usage information of the Wolfram Language symbol.

get.description: Returns Wolfram Language interpretations of a specified entity.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the Wolfram entity (e.g., City, Country).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the entity to be interpreted in Wolfram Language.

200.description: Successful response with the Wolfram Language interpretation of the entity.

interpretation.description: The Wolfram Language interpretation of the provided entity.

get.summary: Use Wolfram Alpha to interpret natural language queries and perform simple computations that do not require code

200.description: The result of the Wolfram|Alpha query

400.description: The request is missing the 'input' parameter

500.description: Wolfram|Alpha was unable to generate a result

501.description: Wolfram|Alpha was unable to generate a result

503.description: Service temporarily unavailable. This may be the result of too many requests.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Natural language input for Wolfram Alpha

parameters.name: assumption
parameters.description: the assumption to use, passed back from a previous query with the same input.

info.title: GPT Store API
info.description: This is an API for a research paper backend. You can use this API to search for papers and get insights.

post.description: Get the vector search results when a search term is applied. This is used for the Global search.

sort.description: The sort order to apply. For time based sorting use newest_first and oldest_first

filter_info.description: Filters to be applied on search

page_info.description: API pagination details. The pagination follows zero-based indexing. This means the first page is indexed as 0.

page.description: Page number to retrieve starting from zero

page_size.description: Number of entities required per page

example 1.summary: Sample request on a query with no filters

value.search_term: How to increase immunity in men ?

example 2.summary: Sample request on a query with filters

value.search_term: Papers on IC engines published between 2020 and 2023 ?

post.description: Get the context for the list of papers to add a column to the GPT search table.

200.summary: Example of fetching context for papers
200.description: This is the example to fetch context for the list of papers.

200.summary: Success response for fetching context for papers
200.description: This is the success response for fetching context for the list of papers.

context: The intraindividual variability (IIV) of cognitive performance has been shown to increase with aging. While brain research has generally focused on mean performance, little is known about neural correlates of cognitive IIV. Nevertheless, some studies suggest that IIV relates more strongly than mean level of performance to the quality of white matter (WM). Our study aims to explore the relation between WM integrity and cognitive IIV by combining functional (fMRI) and structural (diffusion tensor imaging, DTI) imaging. Twelve young adults (aged 1830 years) and thirteen older adults (6182 years) underwent a battery of neuropsychological tasks, along with fMRI and DTI imaging. Their behavioral data were analyzed and correlated with the imaging data at WM regions of interest defined on the basis of (1) the fMRI-activated areas and (2) the Johns Hopkins University (JHU) WM tractography atlas. For both methods, fractional anisotropy, along with the mean, radial, and axial diffusivity parameters, was computed. In accord with previous studies, our results showed that the DTI parameters were more related to IIV than to mean performance. Results also indicated that age differences in the DTI parameters were more pronounced in the regions activated primarily by young adults during a choice reaction-time task than in those also activated in older adults.

Aim To examine the effect of vitamin D level on cognitive function and white matter hyperintensity (WMH) in patients with mild Alzheimer's disease (AD). Methods We recruited patients with mild AD, and carried out clinical interviews, neuropsychological assessments, laboratory tests and brain magnetic resonance imaging. Results In total, 146 patients

display_name.description: The display name of the journal.

official_page.description: The official page of the journal.

id.description: The unique ID of the journal.

unique_id.description: The unique ID of the journal.

full_slug.description: The full slug of the journal.

display_name.description: The display name of the author.

id.description: The unique ID of the author.

unique_id.description: The unique ID of the author.

full_slug.description: The full slug of the author.

Request.title: Get Context For a question on List of Papers

question.description: The question for the column asked by the user.

entity_full_slugs.description: The full slugs of the papers.

Response.title: Generic Response to get context for a list of papers

paper_slug.description: The full slug of the paper.

data.description: The context data for the papers. You should take into consideration the original language in which the user asked the question while consuming this endpoint. The context data is always in english, so you should translate this response to the original language of the user question and generate the final response in the same language in which user asked the question.

id.description: The unique ID of the paper.

full_slug.description: The full slug of the paper.

display_name.description: The display name of the conference series.

official_page.description: The official page of the conference series.

id.description: The unique ID of the conference series.

slug.description: The slug of the conference series.

unique_id.description: The unique ID of the conference series.

full_slug.description: The full slug of the conference series.

is_oa.description: Whether the paper is open access.

publication_type.description: The publication type of the paper.

What story should my brand be telling?

display.name: Scholar AI
display.description: AI Research Assistant  search and review 200M+ scientific papers, patents, and books. Research literature, discover insights, and generate new ideas. Formerly the ScholarAI plugin
prompt_starters: I want to know everything ScholarAI can do!
Find me papers that reference 10.1016 /j.cell.2014.05.010
What's the experimental setup of https://arxiv.org/pdf/ 1808.00177.pdf
Write a review on the use for VR for robotic surgery

info.title: ScholarAI
info.description: Allows the user to search facts and findings from scientific articles

get.summary: Get relevant paper abstracts by search 2-6 relevant keywords.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords of inquiry which should appear in article. Must be in English.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order for results. Valid values are relevance, cited_by_count, publication_date. Defaults to relevance.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The user query

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: The first year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: The last year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first result to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: generative_mode
parameters.description: Boolean "true" or "false" to enable generative mode. If enabled, collate responses using markdown to render in-text citations to the source's url if available. Set this to true by default.

get.summary: Get relevant patents by searching 2-6 relevant keywords.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords of inquiry which should appear in article. Must be in English.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order for results. Valid values are relevance, cited_by_count, publication_date. Defaults to relevance.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The user query. If the user asks for a specific patent, you MUST hit the API using escaped quotation marks

parameters.name: peer_reviewed_only
parameters.description: Whether to only return peer reviewed articles. Defaults to true, ChatGPT should cautiously suggest this value can be set to false

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: The first year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: The last year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first result to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: generative_mode
parameters.description: Boolean "true" or "false" to enable generative mode. If enabled, collate responses using markdown to render in-text citations to the source's url if available. Set this to true by default.

get.summary: Get full text of a paper by URL for PDF incrementally. Good for general summary. DO NOT use this endpoint for singular questions, use /api/question instead.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: pdf_url
parameters.description: URL for PDF

parameters.name: chunk
parameters.description: chunk number to retrieve, defaults to 1

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: doi
parameters.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of article

parameters.name: zotero_user_id
parameters.description: Zotero User ID

parameters.name: zotero_api_key
parameters.description: Zotero API Key

get.summary: Get sections of PDF to answer questions about PDF. ALWAYS use this endpoint if the user has a specific question about a singular PDF.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: The user question. Must be in English.

parameters.name: pdf_url
parameters.description: URL for source PDF

get.summary: Find papers related to another paper using their ss_id

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: ss_id
parameters.description: The ss_id of the paper to find related papers for.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Desired theme of related papers found. Should be provided if the user wants to find similar papers of a particular theme.

parameters.name: adjacent_type
parameters.description: Type of adjacent papers being request. Valid options are 'citedBy', 'references', and 'recommended'. Argument should be a collection of the desired adjacent papers, comma separated. Defaults to 'citedBy,references,recommended'.

get.summary: Find a singular paper's data using an arbitrary identifier, like a DOI or PMID.

parameters.name: full_user_prompt
parameters.description: The entirety of the user request, directly quoted.

parameters.name: paper_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the paper to find. MUST be of the format <identifier_type>:<identifier_value>. Identifier type can be one of DOI, PMID, SS_ID, ARXIV, MAG, ACL, or PMCID.

next_offset.description: The offset of the next page of results.

abstract.description: Summary of the context, methods, results, and conclusions of the paper.

landing_page_url.description: Link to the paper on its open-access host.

publicationDate.description: The date the paper was published in YYYY-MM-DD format.

relevance.description: The relevance of the paper to the search query. 1 is the most relevant.

cited_by_count.description: The number of citations of the article.

chunk_num.description: The chunk number of the paper.

img_mds.description: List of content that appears in the current chunk. Display ALL markdown, including images. The viewing platform ALWAYS supports markdown, ALWAYS show the images.

total_chunk_num.description: The total chunks of the paper.

hint.description: Instructions for GPT to follow regarding this response.

message.description: Confirmation of successful save or error message.

hint.description: Suggestion to use premium or alternative for free users.
